symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.pattern: Intermittent, six-month history in one case

symptoms.name: Decreased breath sounds
symptoms.pattern: Localized to left infra-axillary and infra-scapular area in one case

symptoms.name: Asymptomatic
symptoms.pattern: Can be present in immunocompetent patients

physical_findings: Decreased breath sounds in the left infra-axillary and infra-scapular area (in one case)
Mucosal erythema and mild mucoid secretions in the left tracheobronchial tree (in one case)

lab_values.Pleural fluid analysis: Lymphocytic predominant exudative effusion with low adenosine deaminase (24.8 U/L) in one case

risk_factors: Immunocompromised state (HIV infection, transplant recipients, diabetes mellitus, chronic liver and kidney disease, chronic steroid use, defects of cell-mediated immunity)
No apparent predisposing factors (10-40% of cases)

imaging_findings.Chest radiograph: Left-sided pleural effusion and left hilar prominence (in one case)
imaging_findings.Contrast-enhanced computed tomography (C: Enhanced left hilar mass with ipsilateral pleural effusion (in one case), resolution of pleural effusion with a decrease in the size of the mass after treatment (in one case)
imaging_findings.Other: Single or multiple pulmonary nodules, masses mimicking lung cancer, air space consolidation, and patchy interstitial or alveolar infiltrates

diagnostic_criteria.required: Demonstration of yeast cells in normal sterile tissues (blood, sputum, other body fluids cultures)
supportive: Detection of cryptococcal polysaccharide antigen or Cryptococcus-derived nucleic acids
